intro: Villamilla rivinioides, commonly known as the river vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often along the stems. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found near rivers or in humid forests. Its fibrous roots and vigorous growth make it an important species in ecological studies of wetland ecosystems.
